features.name: Arcane Spellcasting
features.desc: At 1st level, an arcane trickster selects an arcane {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasting{/g} class she belonged to before adding the prestige class. When a new arcane trickster level is gained, the character gains new spells per day and new spells known as if she had also gained a level in that spellcasting class.

features.name: Ranged Legerdemain
features.desc: An arcane trickster can use {g|Encyclopedia:Trickery}Trickery{/g} at a range of 30 feet. Working at a distance increases the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill check{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} by 5.

features.name: Sneak Attack
features.desc:
If a character can catch an opponent when he is unable to defend himself effectively from her {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, she can strike a vital spot for extra {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
The character's attack deals extra damage anytime her target would be denied a {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} (whether the target actually has a Dexterity bonus or not), or when the character {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanks{/g} her target. This extra damage is {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} and increases by 1d6 at later levels. This additional damage is precision damage and is not multiplied on a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}.
The character must be able to see the target well enough to pick out a vital spot and must be able to {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} such a spot.

features.name: Impromptu Sneak Attack
features.desc: Beginning at 3rd level, an arcane trickster can enter a special stance that allows him to improvise a way to sneak {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} targets regardless of their awareness. An arcane trickster can maintain this stance for one {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per day. For every two levels beyond 3rd, an arcane trickster can maintain this stance for one additional round, up to a maximum of 4 rounds at 9th level. The target of impromptu sneak attacks loses any {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, but only against those attacks. The power can be used against any target, but creatures that are not subject to to sneak attacks take no extra {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (though they still lose any Dexterity bonus to AC against the attack).

features.name: Impromptu Sneak Attack
features.desc: Beginning at 3rd level, an arcane trickster can enter a special stance that allows him to improvise a way to sneak {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} targets regardless of their awareness. An arcane trickster can maintain this stance for one {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per day. For every two levels beyond 3rd, an arcane trickster can maintain this stance for one additional round, up to a maximum of 4 rounds at 9th level. The target of impromptu sneak attacks loses any {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, but only against those attacks. This power can be used against any target, but creatures that are not subject to {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g} take no extra {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (though they still lose any Dexterity bonus to AC against the attack).

features.name: Invisible Thief
features.desc: At 9th level, an arcane trickster can become invisible, as if under the effects of greater invisibility, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. She can remain invisible for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to her arcane trickster level. Her {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} for this effect is equal to her caster level. These rounds need not be consecutive.

features.name: Surprise Spells
features.desc: At 10th level, an arcane trickster can add her sneak {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to any {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} that deals damage, if the targets are {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g}. This additional damage only applies to spells that deal hit point damage, and the additional damage is of the same type as the spell. If the spell allows a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} to negate or halve the damage, it also negates or halves the sneak attack damage.
